title: League of Legends Has (Most Likely) Made You a Bad Person
body:
I'm sure this isn't an original thought.  There have probably been dozens of posts about this topic.  

But it still has to be said.  

This community is so toxic that people who play it don't even realize how warped their LoL version of morality has become. 

I haven't played in a couple years.  Decided to install and try it out again.  I made the mistake of saying at the beginning, "hey guys, haven't played for a while, don't be too hard on me."  I should have known that saying that to 4 LoL players would be like telling 4 sharks, "hey, I fell in the water, could you help me out?"--but having been away from this toxic community for a while, I simply behaved as normal people do in society.  Of course my entire team starts insulting me, saying I suck, blaming every death they get on me, blaming me for the loss.  I stayed calm and didn't insult anyone, which seemed to only upset them more.  At the end of the game they all decided they were going to report me.  Not only that, but they told the other team to report me, and the other team just agreed because they were asked to.

To try to make one of the guys understand that telling your teammates they suck doesn't help anything, I presented him with an analogy.  I said, "Tom Brady is better than the other 52 players on his team.  Do you think he constantly tears them down and says they suck?"  The guy insisted that, yes, he thinks Tom Brady does, in fact, tell all his teammates that they suck.  Because, according to this exemplary LoL player, they do suck so of course he tells them they suck.

Anyway, in the morality of LoL, if you join a game in which you are the lowest in skill level, and all 4 of your teammates insult you the entire game and report you, you're the problem.

replies.body:
I think I played over 4,000 games of League of Legends or something xD. I don't think anything/anyone had made a dent in the way I feel or act. 
I never feel stressed, anger, or whatever in any game modes such as Ranked. I never retaliate in a cocky/sly/mischievous manner, with no intention to further stir the flame or patronize my teammates or enemies. I never feel stressed, anger, or whatever in any game modes such as ranked (I always try to learn and do better, and do my best [it's fun]) despite the turmoils I have in games (feeders, trolls, flamers, etc.). If I'm unable to calm them down effectively (no patronizing, condescending, or rude words), I usually have to stay quiet. I don't have all teh wise words o' wisdom to support my teammates... yet xP? 
For others, if they seriously let something like this affect their mentality/personality/whatever, they probably didn't have the capability or mental development to withstand it. But it's like that for almost everyone, even presidents, doctors, police officers, hobos, bodybuilders. Mental development is a lot harder than physical development now in the growing technology world from what I've seen apparently.
Excellent Post.

First, let me apologize that you experienced that. The 4 players you played with sound like assholes. 


However, I agree with Magic in regards to projection. . LoL, cannot make you do, be,or say anything. It's a piece of software. Disagree? Then go to your computer, open LoL and ask it to go to the store and buy some Milk. (I argued the absurd for clarity's sake, not to troll) if it can't respond to a request from you, it cannot likewise make a request on you. 

As for this community, look it will always ultimately be up to the individual on how to react and deal with humanity in general let alone this community. 

I've met just as many good natured people on this board and in game as I have bad natured people.

I hypothesize that a person is already bad if a game, movie, music, an internet post hypothetically causes one to be bad.


If you want and I haven't pissed you off further my comment I play every night. I'd be more than happy to play some norms w/you. 

Hang in there.

I can agree with your point, but only to a certain degree.  The people you surround yourself with--the environment you are in--has a huge influence on you.  If you spend hours everyday in a toxic environment, it is going to have an impact.  You say you have encountered many good people on LoL.  I will take your word for it, but I have had a very different experience and my perception is that most people have as well.

>  If you spend hours everyday in a toxic environment, it is going to have an impact.

That depends on you as a person. I grew up for years in an exceptionally violent environment and had more attempts on my life than anyone would ever be comfortable with. In fact, one such event left me hospitalized and bleeding from my head while my school attempted to cover up the incident and threatened and blackmailed me to keep my mouth shut.

I'm not a nice person, but I try to do the right thing because and especially when no one else will. People react to those pressures differently. Most people shatter from the slightest love tap. I'm jaded from seeing the endless patterns repeat themselves.

It's a fair point you have about influence. However, I maintain it's still in the individuals hands. I worked in a manufacturing plant for 18 years. I was surrounded by good people, but a large majority we're drug addicts, former criminals, criminals to be, abusers, ect. I cannot even begin to describe the human fuckery I witnessed over those 18 years. 

I agree 100% these people caused additional stress in my life. Yet, I remained a good person in spite of it.

 It's because I decided that while my work environment sucked, the workplace itself provided for my family. 

I dealt with the stress and kept my head up and chipped away at my degree. 

Note that I made that decision to get my degree long before I worked in manufacturing. The pursuit of my education was not a result of my working environment.
I cant tell if this is you venting because you are new to the internet and blindly fed some baby trolls, or if this is mass projection.

Exhibit A.  I have no doubt that 95% of the responses will be exactly like this.  And this is why LoL is known the world over for having the absolute worst community in gaming.  Well, not just gaming; anything.  This is the only place where people act like this.

Its a serious question though, have you ever played any other online competitive games? Because if you have, you'd know that in reality League isn't any more toxic than others. And it is by far the most sensitive. I have been playing online games for years, and not a single community reacts as ridiculously as League does when it comes to "toxicity".

Yes, I have.  Not a ton, but a few.  And I agree, there is a certain level of toxicity in every game and in every internet forum.  But I have never seen quite the distortion of morality that I have seen on this game.  If you go into a game and behave as a rational human being, you will immediately be singled out for abuse.  Same thing on these forums.

> Exhibit A.  I have no doubt that 95% of the responses will be exactly like this.  And this is why LoL is known the world over for having the absolute worst community in gaming.  Well, not just gaming; anything.  This is the only place where people act like this.

Symptom of the internet. People think it is okay to be like this and everyone should be like that. You realize it is just annoying after a while.

I understand your point and agree with it, but LoL seems to take it to a different level.

So? You know what it is like, yet you still feed the trolls.

The fact you reacted so angrily to that sort of shows your skin is thinner than paper and you need to learn to not give a fuck before getting on the internet and interacting with dumb people.

Well, shooters had the same type of community before lol and ANY competitive game has this sort of community. Even sports actually, only the best teams don't have players that tear others down after games.   But yeah league has a pretty nasty community and tbh I always mute all at the start of a game.
in the gw2 forums ur post would have been removed in seconds lol they monitor things like crazy but i agree with you
mass projection
Cool story.
Gosh, that's so cliché it hurts to read it.  That's really the best you could do man?
Ye.

tbh, no, I think there are a bunch of psycopaths and sociopaths playing league, I think they would be the same even withouth league, I'd love to see more punishments to those kinds of peopple and I'd love to see all the servers using korea's system in wich your account is linked to your national  id and if you get permabanned it includes your national id, I mean psycopaths won't change no matter what

> [{quoted}](name=Elipo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=6mVfseOO,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2017-08-31T02:00:59.412+0000)
>
> tbh, no, I think there are a bunch of psycopaths and sociopaths playing league, I think they would be the same even withouth league, I'd love to see more punishments to those kinds of peopple and I'd love to see all the servers using korea's system in wich your account is linked to your national  id and if you get permabanned it includes your national id, I mean psycopaths won't change no matter what

I haven't met a single psychopath on EUNE - EUW ? I dont know what kinda dick players are playing on NA but i guarantee you that a psycho or sociopath wouldn't lose his time on this game. And punishments are already harsh enough. Punishments  are: 10 game chat restriciton, 25 game chat restriciton, 14 days ban, perma ban. What else you want ?  And even this punishment system is buggy as hell and doesnt work as intended. It's all because there are programmed  bad words "fuck you" "you're shit", "kill yourself", "kys", etc. and if system recognizes one of those words-sentences you will get banned after a 1 report. It doesnt matter if you were quoting someone or you were joking or stuff like that. I've been told  to kill myself by my teammate, and i said "kys ????", only quoting, got reported by that stupid premade, and got a 14 day suspension , and ofc i won't get my plat rewards. Countless times i jumped from 10 games chat restrict to 2 weeks ban or even a perma ban, simply because the "machine" is the one who bans, and im pretty sure there  has to be a few "If" added by developers, because skipping punishment level is not okay. And also, i've noticed that bad things in this game are more dominating than a good ones. 
Example:
Go on a 12 games winning streak -> Your mmr will be better than your division for like 50-100 poiints
Go on a  3 games losing streak after -> Your mmr will be lower than your division, your LP gains will be abnormaly low.
Flame -> Go on a 10 games chat restriction
Flame for the same amount -> Skip 25 game chat restriction, get instant 14 day ban.
Etc etc.
Honestly, at this point i think they just removed a 25 game chat restriction and just made us go from 10 games chat r. to 14 day ban. Even my friends didnt receive a 25 game chat restriction for  like a season. Pretty sure its removed. Just to get rid of flamers, but save trolls and feeders <3.

TLDR: No, i think there shouldnt be more punishments. The only punishment left is IP ban, which would massively cut down their $$ gain and active player number. I think atleast 80% of the community has atleast 1 permabanned acc.

So a toxic player is saying there shouldn't be more punishments... If someone gets permabanned they shouldn't be able to create another account. I've never gotten any kind of punishment because I'm not toxic. Period. If you've gotten a permabanned account then league would be better withouth you.

You are literally saying there are too many punishments because you keep being punished after continously being a dick. But you are still playing. So they are not enough. Also it seems you don't know what a psycopath or sociopath is.

> [{quoted}](name=Elipo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=6mVfseOO,comment-id=000e00000000,timestamp=2017-08-31T21:07:17.699+0000)
>
> So a toxic player is saying there shouldn't be more punishments... If someone gets permabanned they shouldn't be able to create another account. I've never gotten any kind of punishment because I'm not toxic. Period. If you've gotten a permabanned account then league would be better withouth you.
> 
> You are literally saying there are too many punishments because you keep being punished after continously being a dick. But you are still playing. So they are not enough. Also it seems you don't know what a psycopath or sociopath is.

Yes. I might be toxic. But you know what's the difference between me and you ?
I'm a good player actually. And i made it to 2% of the players with ONE champion (Tryndamere) on multiple accounts (excluding 2 of them, this one is one of my first accs so i was bad back then).
While you're being nice, not flaming, and hardstuck in your Silver elo (you're unranked, but you're surely gonna be hardstuck in Silver 5-3 range).
So, my 6 permabanned accoutns are higher elo than you will ever be.
Trust me, if i dont know what socio or psycho is then nobody does ;) I've been seeing those guys IRL and nobody on league seems like that. But, again. NA is a weird server so idk what's happening there. I'm just too good to play on NA, sorry.

Yeah, because my post is about elo and I deeply care about all of your accounts' elo. Actually my post's main point was about you because you are so important. *rolls eyes* 

Bye.

bye.
Definitely flame more since I began playing LoL. Before 2012 I was a very chill dude. Than got toxier every year >.<

I didnt have anger issues until i started playing this shitty video game. Now i do. And i have 5-6 permabanned accounts. I was always nice towards the people online and didnt care if someone tried to argue with me online. But since i started playing this game, i get so angry after the smallest mistake made by my teammate. I get so triggered after every bad word said to me. It's ridiculous what this game has done to me.

League? pffft 

More like the internet in general :D

I took half a year off to deal with a stalker in real life. When I came back a lot had changed, but I still ended up knowing infinitely more than most of the community, and what was new, I re-learned in less than a week. I keep running into people who still don't know what the trinkets or support items do, even though it's been four goddamn years since they were created, or that there's a ward limit now, or what the dragons do.

By the way, I'm a support main. I'm forced to care about the well-being of my teammates, as much as I'd like to kill them the instant they become a liability to me. Whenever we overspecialize in AD melee assassin damage (which is always), I point out exactly what we are missing. No one has caught on yet, even after four hundred septillion cycles of the universe.

> [{quoted}](name=Lost R,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=6mVfseOO,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-08-30T20:14:17.605+0000)
>
> I took half a year off to deal with a stalker in real life. When I came back a lot had changed, but I still ended up knowing infinitely more than most of the community, and what was new, I re-learned in less than a week. I keep running into people who still don't know what the trinkets or support items do, even though it's been four goddamn years since they were created, or that there's a ward limit now, or what the dragons do.
> 
> By the way, I'm a support main. I'm forced to care about the well-being of my teammates, as much as I'd like to kill them the instant they become a liability to me. Whenever we overspecialize in AD melee assassin damage (which is always), I point out exactly what we are missing. No one has caught on yet, even after four hundred septillion cycles of the universe.

You are an excellent example of what I'm talking about, both in the views you've internalized and in your lack of self-awareness about it.

I am aware of my jadedness and murderous desires, but I try to warn the team whenever they go all AD melee assassin, because it takes not even just a single champion, but a single skill to utterly, thoroughly, and casually destroy them. Which always happens, without fail. No one builds Grevious Wounds for the healers, or armor piercing or percent damage for the tanks. Even Lethality is completely ignored these days. I've had more than too many players who insisted they could outdamage Soraka's heals and tried to flash ult the enemy ADC, only to get locked down and destroyed before they could even so much as dent them even slightly.

I tell them to back off when I know the jungler's coming, yet they ignore me. I tell them to grab the infernal dragon (the only dragon anyone actually cares about) while the entire enemy team is dead, yet they squabble over a single jungle camp and ignore me. They bitch at me to rush the sightstone, even though I already have the Eye of the Watchers/Equinox and ignore both me AND the wards I have already laid down, even though the entire enemy team is on the other side of the map, only to try to contest the dragon minutes later, after the enemy team has slogged their way across the entire map and that window of opportunity has long since closed and then blame me for their hesitation and bullshittery regarding that one jungle camp, which they couldn't even take because it got stolen by the enemy Shaco. All the while they delegate me, the support, to defending and pushing all three lanes only to bitch at me for split pushing in the same breath while they try to teamfight an entire team that has every possible given advantage over them because nobody wanted to grab any objective.

I've seen this happen more times than you will ever want to think about, and nobody seems to learn from those mistakes. In fact, they double, triple, and even quintuple down on it. They also shit on the supports, the first, last and only person in the world who might actually give a damn about them, and treat them like an infinitely expendable resource, even though supports players are unimaginably rare.
without reading the full post, i totally agree. LoL has made me so angry towards people.

I'm normally a pretty chill person and rarely get mad at people; this game actually had me lose it on one of my friends because the fed Zed kept 100-0ing me repeatedly and I felt I could do nothing about it, so I lost it and yell at my friend who was playing Jungle at the time. This game and how its designed just turns you against people.

made me cynical, when i see shit blow up in peoples faces/public drama anywhere i just cant help it but smile and laugh on the inside because its funny as hell........i used to be caring now i'm just like haha gg noob you just felt lifes kick
I agree 100% and that why someone needs to shut the game down..however means are neccessary...

Most likely made you a bad person? I don't know... I think it's made me a more patient person. I have a much higher tolerance to BS and can brush things off a lot easier after League because of having to deal with horrible people and watching their behavior devolve and thinking "shit I don't ever want to be like that person."
you're in a giant social experiment, they are using the meta data to learn ways to better control humanity. This whole thing stinks to high hell.

Yeah then you take it for 20 games then call one moron inbred and get a 10 game chat ban, do that 3 times over a month and enjoy a ban every month. The system is flawed they know it we know it, the only thing that will change it is forcing them to follow real laws rather than made up ones they control the outcome of. Most of the toxic people i have met over the years of playing this have been non-north Americans. They come here with grudges and hatred, they want their turn to be hollywood and watch out they will tilt you in ways that only makes it easier for them.

All of league is based off this ideology:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c6Ob5ne70a4
To the title, false it simply magnifies the bad side that was forged long ago do to the scum of humanity.
It gives me a place to vent my IRL anxiety. Its a lie of course. It just makes it easier to fake being normal.

I'll admit when I first started league I wasn't too toxic since I was playing the game for fun. After I while when I started to take the game more seriously I become pretty toxic (:/ sry for anyone I flamed back them). It took me a while but when I finally got to gold, I had super friendly and nice team mates pretty much every game. I dunno what happened, but I basically stopped being toxic. Not sure if this game actually made my mental health better (or worse), but I have finally realized that the mute option is one of the best features in the game :)
I like to think that LoL just gave me the right outlet to achieve my true final form.
